translations.text: آنها از فرمان پروردگارشان سرباز زدند، و صاعقه آنان را فراگرفت در حالی که (خیره خیره) نگاه می‌کردند (بی‌آنکه قدرت دفاع داشته باشند)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس سرکشیدند از فرمان پروردگار خویش پس بگرفتشان صاعقه و بودند نگرانان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنان از فرمان پروردگارشان سرپيچى كردند پس صاعقه- آتش آسمانى- بگرفتشان در حالى كه خود مى‌نگريستند- يا انتظار مى‌بردند-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس از فرمان پروردگارشان سر برتافتند تا در حالی که آنها می‌نگریستند، آذرخش (جانکاه) آنان را فرو گرفت.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But they disobeyed the command of their Lord; so they were destroyed by a thunderbolt, and they could only gape,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: In response they rebelled against their Lord’s command, so the thunderbolt seized them whilst they were watching.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then they turned in disdain from the commandment of their Lord, and the thunderbolt took them and they themselves beholding

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then they disdained the command of their Lord; wherefore the bolt laid hold of them even while they looked on.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But they insolently defied the Command of their Lord, so the Sa'iqah overtook them while they were looking.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But they defied the command of their Lord, so the lightning struck them as they looked on.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But they brazenly disobeyed their Lord's command, and then a sudden chastisement overtook them while they looked on.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But they insolently defied the command of their Lord, so the Sa`iqah overtook them while they were looking.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But they rebelled against their Lord's decree, and so the thunderbolt overtook them even while they gazed;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then they defied the command of their Lord; so the thunderbolt seized them as they looked on.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But in their pride they turn away from the commandment of their Lord and the thunderbolt struck them whilst they were looking;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But they were insolent toward the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They transgressed against the command of their Lord. So a blast of sound struck them and they were unable to do anything but stare.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But they revolted against the commandment of their Lord, so the rumbling overtook them while they saw.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: FaAAataw AAan amri rabbihim faakhathathumu alssaAAiqatu wahum yanthuroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But they rebelled against the command of their Lord. So the thunderbolt overtook them while they looked on:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But they insolently defied the Command of their Lord: So the stunning noise (of an earthquake) seized them, even while they were looking on.

verses.text: فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا مِنْ‌ قِيَامٍ‌ وَ مَا کَانُوا مُنْتَصِرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس [با آمدن عذاب و به سبب اینکه هیچ مهلتی نیافتند] نه قدرت برخاستن از جای خود را داشتند و نه دادخواهی کردند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ايستادن نتوانستند و ياراى انتقام نداشتند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [چنان بر زمين افتادند] كه نه توانستند برخيزند و نه از خود دفاع كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در نتيجه نه توانستند به پاى خيزند و نه طلب يارى كنند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در حالی که نه هیچ توانایی برخاستن (و گریختن) داشتند و نه هیچ یار و مددکاری یافتند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان (چنان نقش زمین شدند که) نتوانستند برخیزند و نتوانستند (از کسی یاری بطلبند و) خویشتن را کمک کنند. [[«مُنتَصِرِینَ»: یاری‌دهندگان. کمک‌کنندگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه توان ایستادن هم نداشتند و کین‌ستان نبودند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: چنان بر زمین افتادند که توان برخاستن نداشتند و نتوانستند از کسی یاری طلبند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس نیارستند ایستادن را و نبودند یاری‌جویان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس برخاستن نتوانستند و ياراى دفاع از خود نداشتند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس هرگز نه توانستند به پای خیزند و نه جویندگان یارانی بوده‌اند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And neither stand up nor defend themselves.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So they were neither able to stand up, nor were they able to take revenge.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and they were not able to stand upright, and were not helped.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So they were not able to stand, nor could they help themselves.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then they were unable to rise up, nor could they help themselves.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They could not rise up, nor could they find help.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They were unable even to stand up or protect themselves.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then they were unable to rise up, nor could they help themselves.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they were unable to rise up, nor could they help themselves.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So they were neither able to rise up, nor to come to one another’s aid.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: they could neither stand up straight, nor were they helped.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they were unable to arise, nor could they defend themselves.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They were unable to stand up, nor were they helped.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So they were not able to rise up, nor could they defend themselves-

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fama istataAAoo min qiyamin wama kanoo muntasireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: they could not stand up again, nor could they defend themselves.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then they could not even stand (on their feet), nor could they help themselves.

verses.text: وَ قَوْمَ‌ نُوحٍ‌ مِنْ‌ قَبْلُ‌ إِنَّهُمْ‌ کَانُوا قَوْماً فَاسِقِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و قوم نوح را پیش از این [هلاک کردیم]؛ زیرا آنان همواره مردمی نافرمان بودند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و از پيش قوم نوح را فروگرفتيم، كه قومى نافرمان بودند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و از پيش، قوم نوح را [كيفر نموديم، زيرا] آنان قومى نافرمان بودند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و قوم نوح [نيز] پيش از آن [اقوام نامبرده همين گونه هلاك شدند]، زيرا آنها مردمى نافرمان بودند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و پیش از این اقوام هم قوم نوح را هلاک کردیم که مردمی فاسق و نابکار بودند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پیش از آنان، ما قوم نوح را هلاک ساخته بودیم. چرا که ایشان قوم فاسقی بوده و (با انجام کفر و معاصی) از فرمان خدا خارج شده بودند. [[«کَانُوا قَوْماً فَاسِقِینَ»: (نگا: نمل / 12، زخرف / 54).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و قوم نوح از آن پیش، که آنان قومی نافرمان بودند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: همچنین قوم نوح را پیش از آنها هلاک کردیم، چرا که قوم فاسقی بودند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و قوم نوح را از پیش که بودند ایشان قومی نافرمانان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و قوم نوح را پيش از اين- پيش از عاد و ثمود- [هلاك كرديم‌]، زيرا مردمى بدكار و نافرمان بودند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و گروه نوح را (نیز) از پیش (از آن اقوام همین گونه هلاک کردیم). آنان بی‌گمان گروهی فاسق [:نافرمان] بوده‌اند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (So had We destroyed) the people of Noah before them: They were surely a sinful people.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And before them, We destroyed the people of Nooh; they were indeed a sinning nation.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And the people of Noah before; surely they were an ungodly people.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And the people of Nuh We destroyed aforetime; verily they were a people transgressing.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (So were) the people of Nuh (Noah) before them. Verily, they were a people who were Fasiqun (rebellious, disobedient to Allah).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And before that, the people of Noah. They were immoral people.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Before all these We destroyed the people of Noah: they were a wicked people.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (So were) the people of Nuh before them. Verily, they were a people who were rebellious.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And the folk of Noah aforetime. Lo! they were licentious folk.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And the people of Noah aforetime. Indeed, they were a transgressing lot.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And before them the nation of Noah, indeed they were a debauched nation.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And [We destroyed] the people of Noah before; indeed, they were a people defiantly disobedient.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The people of Noah who lived before them were also evil doing people.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the people of Nuh before, surely they were a transgressing people.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waqawma noohin min qablu innahum kanoo qawman fasiqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: [We destroyed] the people of Noah before them. They were certainly a sinful people.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So were the People of Noah before them for they wickedly transgressed.

verses.text: وَ السَّمَاءَ بَنَيْنَاهَا بِأَيْدٍ وَ إِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آسمان را به قدرت ونیرو بنا کردیم و ما [همواره] وسعت دهنده ایم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آسمان را به نيرو برافراشتيم و حقا كه ما تواناييم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آسمان را با دستان [قدرت‌] خود بنا نهاديم و البته ما گسترش دهنده [ى آن‌] هستيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و آسمان را به قدرت خود برافراشتيم، و بى‌گمان، ما [آسمان‌]گستريم!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و کاخ رفیع آسمان را ما به قدرت خود برافراشتیم و ماییم که مقتدریم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما آسمان را با قدرت بنا ساخته‌ایم و همواره آن را وسعت می‌بخشیم. [[«أَیْدٍ»: قدرت و قوت (نگا: ص / 17). در رسم‌الخط قرآنی با دو یاء نوشته شده است. «لَمُوسِعُونَ»: جمع مُوسِع، دارای قدرت و توانائی. گسترش‌دهنده. «إِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ»: این بخش از آیه، اشاره به نظریه گسترش جهان دارد. علم امروز ثابت کرده است که نه تنها کره زمین، بر اثر مواد آسمانی تدریجاً فربه و سنگین‌تر می‌شود، بلکه آسمانها نیز در حال گسترش هستند. ستارگانی که در یک کهکشان قرار دارند، به سرعت از مرکز کهکشان دور می‌شوند، و میلیاردها کهکشان در فضای جهان از یکدیگر دور می‌گردند، و بالاخره جهان پیوسته در حال انبساط و توسعه است. حتی دانشمندان می‌گویند: تمام کرات آسمانی و کهکشانها در آغاز در مرکز واحدی جمع بوده - با وزن مخصوص فوق‌العاده سنگین - سپس انفجار عظیم و بسیار وحشتناکی در آن رخ داده، و به دنبال آن، اجزای جهان متلاشی شده، و به صورت کرات درآمده است، و به سرعت در حال عقب‌نشینی و توسعه است (نگا: المنتخب. نمونه).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و آسمان را توانمندانه برافراشتیم و ما توانمندیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و ما آسمان را با قدرت بنا کردیم، و همواره آن را وسعت می‌بخشیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و آسمان را بنیاد نهادیم به نیرویی و همانا مائیم فراخی‌دهندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آسمان را به نيرو برافراشتيم و هر آينه ما تواناييم- يا گسترش‌دهنده‌ايم-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و آسمان را به نیروهایی برافراشتیم و بی‌گمان، همانا ما توسعه‌‌دهند‌گانیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We built the heavens by Our authority; and We are the Lord of power and expanse.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We have built the heaven with hands (the Divine Power), and it is We Who give the expanse.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And heaven -- We built it with might, and We extend it wide.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And the heaven! We have built it with might, and verily We are powerful.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: With power did We construct the heaven. Verily, We are Able to extend the vastness of space thereof.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We constructed the universe with power, and We are expanding it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And heaven – We made it with Our Own Power and We have the Power to do so.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: With Hands We constructed the heaven. Verily, We are able to expand the vastness of space thereof.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: We have built the heaven with might, and We it is Who make the vast extent (thereof).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We have built the heaven with might, and indeed it is We who are its expanders.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We built the heaven with might, and We widely extended it.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the heaven We constructed with strength, and indeed, We are [its] expander.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We have made the heavens with Our own hands and We expanded it.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the heaven, We raised it high with power, and most surely We are the makers of things ample.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waalssamaa banaynaha biaydin wainna lamoosiAAoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We built the universe with Our might, giving it its vast expanse.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: With power and skill did We construct the Firmament: for it is We Who create the vastness of pace.

verses.text: وَ الْأَرْضَ‌ فَرَشْنَاهَا فَنِعْمَ‌ الْمَاهِدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و زمین را گستردیم و چه نیکو گستراننده ای هستیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و زمين را گسترديم، و چه نيكو گسترندگانيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و زمين را گسترديم و نيكو گسترندگانى هستيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و زمين را گسترانيده‌ايم و چه نيكو گسترندگانيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و زمین را بگستردیم و چه نیکو مهدی بگستردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و زمین را پهن کرده‌ایم (و برای زندگی مردمان آماده ساخته‌ایم) و چه آماده‌کنندگان خوبی بوده‌ایم! [[«فَرَشْنَاهَا»: زمین را پهن کرده‌ایم. «الْمَاهِدُونَ»: جمع ماهِد، آماده سازنده. خدای مهربان زمین را برای زندگی مردمان همچون گهواره آماده فرموده است و چنانکه باید برای آسایش ایشان فراهم آورده است (نگا: طه / 53، زخرف / 10).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و زمین را گستراندیم چه نیکو گستراننده‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و زمین را گستردیم، و چه خوب گستراننده‌ای هستیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و زمین را گسترانیدیم پس چه خوبند گسترانندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و زمين را گسترانيديم و چه نيكو گسترانيده‌ايم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و زمین را رام و راهوار گسترانیدیم‌؛ پس چه نیکو گسترندگانیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We spread the earth a carpet; what comfort We provide!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We made the earth a base, so how well do We lay out!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And the earth -- We spread it forth; O excellent Smoothers!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And the earth! We have stretched it forth beneath; an excellent Spreader are We!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We have spread out the earth, how Excellent Spreader (thereof) are We!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And the earth—We spread it out—How well We prepared it!

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And the earth – We spread it out, and how well have We smoothed it!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We have made the earth a Firash; how excellent spreader (thereof) are We!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And the earth have We laid out, how gracious is the Spreader (thereof)!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And We have spread out the earth, so how excellent spreaders We have been!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and We cradled the earth. And We are the Best of Cradlers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the earth We have spread out, and excellent is the preparer.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We have spread out the earth and how brilliantly it is spread!

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the earth, We have made it a wide extent; how well have We then spread (it) out.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waalarda farashnaha faniAAma almahidoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We have spread out the earth, how well We have spread it out,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We have spread out the (spacious) earth: How excellently We do spread out!

verses.text: وَ مِنْ‌ کُلِ‌ شَيْ‌ءٍ خَلَقْنَا زَوْجَيْنِ‌ لَعَلَّکُمْ‌ تَذَکَّرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: واز هر چیزی جفت آفریدیم باشد که متذکّر [این حقایق که نشانه هایی بر قدرت، حکمت و ربوبیت خداست] شوید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و از هر چيز جفتى بيافريده‌ايم، باشد كه عبرت گيريد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و از هر چيزى دو زوج آفريديم، اميد كه شما عبرت گيريد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و از هر چيزى دو گونه [يعنى نر و ماده‌] آفريديم، اميد كه شما عبرت گيريد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و از هر چیزی دو نوع (نر و ماده) بیافریدیم تا مگر متذکر (حکمت خدا) شوید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما از هر چیز جفتی را آفریده‌ایم، تا این که شما (عظمت آفریدگار را) یاد کنید. [[«زَوْجَیْنِ»: یک جفت نر و ماده در جهان جانداران و گیاهان و جمادات و غیره (نگا: شعراء / 7، یس / 36، زخرف / 12، طه / 53).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و از هر چیز گونه‌هایی آفریدیم باشد که پند گیرید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و از هر چیز دو جفت آفریدیم، شاید متذکّر شوید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و از هر چیزی آفریدیم دو جُفت شاید یادآور شوید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و از هر چيزى دو گونه- كه يكى جفت ديگرى است- آفريديم، باشد كه ياد كنيد و پند گيريد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و از هر چیزی دو گونه [:جفت یکدیگر] آفریدیم، شاید شما یاد کنید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And We created pairs of everything that you may contemplate.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We created all things in pairs, so that you may ponder.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And of everything created We two kinds; haply you will remember.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And of every thing We have created pairs, that haply ye may remember.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And of everything We have created pairs, that you may remember (the Grace of Allah).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We created all things in pairs, so that you may reflect and ponder.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And of everything We have created pairs; perhaps you will take heed.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And of everything We have created pairs, that you may remember.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And all things We have created by pairs, that haply ye may reflect.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: In all things We have created pairs so that you may take admonition.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We created two kinds of all things, so that you will remember.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And of all things We created two mates; perhaps you will remember.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We have created everything in pairs so that perhaps you may take heed.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And of everything We have created pairs that you may be mindful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wamin kulli shayin khalaqna zawjayni laAAallakum tathakkaroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and We created pairs of all things so that you might reflect.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And of every thing We have created pairs: That ye may receive instruction.

verses.text: فَفِرُّوا إِلَى‌ اللَّهِ‌ إِنِّي‌ لَکُمْ‌ مِنْهُ‌ نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس به سوی خدا بگریزید [که] بی تردید من از سوی او بیم دهنده ای روشنگرم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس به سوى خداوند بگريزيد. من شما را از جانب او بيم‌دهنده‌اى آشكارم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس به سوى خدا بگريزيد كه من شما را از طرف او بيم دهنده‌اى آشكارم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس به سوى خدا بگريزيد، كه من شما را از طرف او بيم‌دهنده‌اى آشكارم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: باری، به درگاه خدا گریزید، که من از جانب او با بیانی روشن شما را می‌ترسانم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: به سوی (عبادت) خدا بشتابید. من بیم‌دهنده‌ی آشکاری از سوی او برای شما هستم (و پیغمبری من با دلائل و معجزات، برای شما روشن است). [[«فِرُّوا»: بگریزید. مراد گریختن از کفر و بت‌پرستی، به سوی خداشناسی و یکتاپرستی، و از گناهان و سیئات، به سوی عبادات و حسنات است. خلاصه گریز از موجبات عذاب و شقاوت، به سوی موجبات نعمت و سعادت. «مُبِینٌ»: آشکار. یعنی پیغمبری من با دلائل و معجزات، روشن است، و برای شما ناشناخته نیست.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس در خداوند بگریزید، که من برای شما از جانب او هشداردهنده‌ای آشکارم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس به سوی خدا بگریزید، که من از سوی او برای شما بیم‌دهنده‌ای آشکارم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس بگریزید بسوی خدا که منم برای شما از او ترساننده آشکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس به سوى خداى بگريزيد- به خداى باز گرديد- همانا من از سوى او شما را بيم‌دهنده‌اى آشكارم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس فراسوی خدا فرار کنید. من بی‌گمان برایتان از (سوی) او ترساننده‌ای روشنگرم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So turn to God. I give you a clear warning from Him.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Therefore rush towards Allah; indeed I am from Him, a clear Herald of Warning towards you.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Therefore flee unto God! I am a clear warner from Him to you.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Flee therefore Unto Allah; verily I am Unto you from Him a warner manifest.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So flee to Allah (from His Torment to His Mercy Islamic Monotheism), verily, I (Muhammad SAW) am a plain warner to you from Him.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “So flee towards God. I am to you from Him a clear warner.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Flee, therefore, to Allah. Surely I am a clear warner to you from Him;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, flee to Allah. Verily, I am a plain warner to you from Him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Therefor flee unto Allah; lo! I am a plain warner unto you from him.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘So flee toward Allah. Indeed, I am from Him a manifest warner to you.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Therefore, flee to Allah. I am a clear warner to you from Him.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So flee to Allah. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), tell them,"Seek refuge in God. I have been sent from Him to plainly warn you.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore fly to Allah, surely I am a plain warner to you from Him.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fafirroo ila Allahi innee lakum minhu natheerun mubeenun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Therefore hasten to God; truly, I am sent by Him to give you clear warning.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Hasten ye then (at once) to Allah: I am from Him a Warner to you, clear and open!

verses.text: وَ لاَ تَجْعَلُوا مَعَ‌ اللَّهِ‌ إِلٰهاً آخَرَ إِنِّي‌ لَکُمْ‌ مِنْهُ‌ نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و با خدا معبودی دیگر قرار ندهید، یقیناً من از سوی او بیم دهنده ای آشکارم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و با خداى يكتا خداى ديگرى را مپرستيد. من شما را از جانب او بيم‌دهنده‌اى آشكارم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و با خدا معبود ديگرى قرار مدهيد به راستى من از جانب او براى شما هشدار دهنده‌اى آشكارم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و با خدا معبودى ديگر قرار مدهيد كه من از جانب او هشداردهنده‌اى آشكارم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و هرگز با خدای یکتا خدایی دیگر نپرستید که من از جانب او با بیانی روشن شما را می‌ترسانم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: با خدا، معبود دیگری را انباز مسازید. من بیم‌دهنده و بیانگر (عاقبت وحشتناک شرک و بت‌پرستی) از سوی خدا برای شما می‌باشم. [[«مُبِینٌ»: بیانگر. یعنی عاقبت دردناک بت‌پرستی و شرک را برایتان بیان میدارم و کژراهه شقاوت را از شاهراه سعادت برایتان جدا می‌سازم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و در جنب خداوند خدایی دیگر قائل مشوید که من برای شما از جانب او هشداردهنده‌ای آشکارم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و با خدا معبود دیگری قرار ندهید، که من برای شما از سوی او بیم‌دهنده‌ای آشکارم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و قرار ندهید با خدا خدائی دیگر همانا منم برای شما از او ترساننده آشکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و با خداى يكتا خدايى ديگر مگيريد، همانا من از سوى او شما را بيم‌دهنده‌اى آشكارم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و با خدا معبودی دیگر قرار مدهید. همانا من از جانب او هشداردهنده‌ای روشنگرم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do not set up another god with God. I give you a clear warning from Him.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And do not appoint other deities along with Allah; indeed I am from Him, a clear Herald of Warning towards you.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And set not up with God another god; I am a clear warner from Him to you.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And set not up another god with Allah; verily I am Unto you from Him a warner manifest.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And set not up (or worship) any other ilahan (god) along with Allah [Glorified be He (Alone), Exalted above all that they associate as partners with Him]. Verily, I (Muhammad SAW) am a plain warner to you from Him.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “And do not set up any other god with God. I am to you from Him a clear warner.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and do not set up any deity with Allah. Surely I am a clear warner to you from Him.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And set not up any other god along with Allah. Verily, I am a plain warner to you from Him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And set not any other god along with Allah; lo! I am a plain warner unto you from Him.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do not set up another god besides Allah. Indeed I am from Him a manifest warner to you.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Do not set up with Allah another god. I am a clear warner to you from Him.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do not choose other gods besides Him. I have been sent from Him to plainly warn you".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And do not set up with Allah another god: surely I am a plain warner to you from Him.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wala tajAAaloo maAAa Allahi ilahan akhara innee lakum minhu natheerun mubeenun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do not set up another god, along with God. I come from Him to warn you plainly.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And make not another an object of worship with Allah: I am from Him a Warner to you, clear and open!

verses.text: کَذٰلِکَ‌ مَا أَتَى‌ الَّذِينَ‌ مِنْ‌ قَبْلِهِمْ‌ مِنْ‌ رَسُولٍ‌ إِلاَّ قَالُوا سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: همچنین هیچ پیامبری بر کسانی که پیش از اینان بودند نیامد مگر اینکه گفتند: جادوگر یا دیوانه است!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بدين سان بر آنهايى كه از اين پيش بودند پيامبرى مبعوث نشد جز آنكه گفتند: جادوگرى است، يا ديوانه‌اى است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همچنين، براى كسانى كه پيش از آنها بودند هيچ پيامبرى نيامد جز اين كه گفتند: ساحرى يا ديوانه‌اى است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بدين سان بر كسانى كه پيش از آنها بودند هيچ پيامبرى نيامد جز اينكه گفتند: «ساحر يا ديوانه‌اى است.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: همچنان (که تو را ای رسول تکذیب کردند) هیچ رسولی بر امم پیشین نیامد جز آنکه (او را تکذیب کرده و) گفتند: او ساحر یا دیوانه است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: همین گونه (که اینان شما را تکذیب می‌دارند) هیچ پیغمبری به سوی مردمان پیش از ایشان نرفته است، مگر این که گفته‌اند: او جادوگر یا دیوانه است. [[«کَذلِکَ»: بهمین صورت. کار به همین منوال است. خبر مبتدای محذوف است و تقدیر چنین است: أَلأََمْرُ کَذلِکَ.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بدین‌سان برای پیشینیان آنان هیچ پیامبری نیامد مگر آنکه گفتند [او] جادوگر یا دیوانه است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: این گونه است که هیچ پیامبری قبل از اینها بسوی قومی فرستاده نشد مگر اینکه گفتند: «او ساحر است یا دیوانه!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بدینسان نیامد آنان را که پیش از ایشان بودند فرستاده‌ای جز آنکه گفتند جادوگری است یا دیوانه‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همچنين بدان كسان نيز كه پيش از اينان- كفار مكه- بودند هيچ پيامبرى نيامد مگر آنكه گفتند: جادوگر است يا ديوانه.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بدین‌سان کسانی راکه پیش از آنان بودند هیچ پیامبری نیامد جز (اینکه) گفتند: «ساحری یا دیوانه‌ای است.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Even thus no apostle came to those before them but they said: "He is a sorcerer or a mad man."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Similarly, whenever a Noble Messenger came to those before them they always said, “He is a magician or a madman.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Even so not a Messenger came to those before them but they said, 'A sorcerer, or a man possessed!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Likewise, there came not an apostle Unto those before them but they said: a magician or a madman!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Likewise, no Messenger came to those before them, but they said: "A sorcerer or a madman!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Likewise, no messenger came to those before them, but they said, “A sorcerer or a madman.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Thus has it been (in the past): never did a Messenger come to the nations that preceded them but they said: “(He is) a sorcerer, or a mad-man.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Likewise, no Messenger came to those before them but they said: "A sorcerer or a madman!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Even so there came no messenger unto those before them but they said: A wizard or a madman!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So it was that there did not come any apostle to those who were before them but they said, ‘A magician,’ or ‘A crazy man!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Similarly, no Messenger came to those before them but they said: 'Sorcerer, or mad'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Similarly, there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said, "A magician or a madman."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: In the same way no Messenger came to those who lived before them without his people calling him a magician or an insane person.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Thus there did not come to those before them an apostle but they said: A magician or a mad man.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kathalika ma ata allatheena min qablihim min rasoolin illa qaloo sahirun aw majnoonun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Likewise, there came no messenger to those before them, but they said, "He is a sorcerer or a madman."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Similarly, no messenger came to the Peoples before them, but they said (of him) in like manner, "A sorcerer, or one possessed"!

verses.text: أَ تَوَاصَوْا بِهِ‌ بَلْ‌ هُمْ‌ قَوْمٌ‌ طَاغُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا [این اقوام] یکدیگر را به این گونه داوری [ناحق درباره پیامبرشان] سفارش کرده بودند؟! [نه] بلکه همه آنان گروهی یاغی و سرکش بودند [و این یاوه گویی ها، محصول سرکشی و یاغی گری آنان بود.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا بدين كار يكديگر را وصيت كرده بودند؟ نه، خود مردمى طاغى بودند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا همديگر را به اين [سخن‌] سفارش كرده بودند؟ [نه،] بلكه آنان مردمى سركش بودند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا همديگر را به اين [سخن‌] سفارش كرده بودند؟ [نه!] بلكه آنان مردمى سركش بودند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا بر این تکذیب، مردم اعصار به یکدیگر سفارش کرده‌اند؟ (یا نه؟) بلکه این مردم (همه بالذّات) گروهی سرکش و نافرمانند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مگر همدیگر را (به گفتن چنین سخنی) سفارش کرده‌اند؟! نه، بلکه آنان مردمان طغیانگریند (و عامل وحدت عمل ایشان همان روحیّه‌ی واحد خبیث طغیانگریشان است). [[«أَ تَوَاصَوْا بِهِ»: همزه استفهام برای تعجب است و مراد این است که ای مردم! مایه تعجب است که بی‌دینان انگار یکدیگر را به تکذیب انبیاء سفارش کرده‌اند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا همدیگر را بدان سفارش کرده‌اند؟ حق این است که قومی طغیانگرند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا یکدیگر را به آن سفارش می‌کردند (که همه چنین تهمتی بزنند)؟! نه، بلکه آنها قومی طغیانگرند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا اندرز دادند یکدیگر را بدان بلکه ایشانند گروهی گردنکشان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا يكديگر را بدين [سخن‌] سفارش كرده بودند؟ [نه،] بلكه آنها مردمى سركش بودند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا همدیگر را به این (سخن) سفارش کردند؟ (نه!) بلکه آنان مردمی سرکشند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Is this the legacy they have passed down from one to the other? In fact, they are a rebellious people.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: What! Have they willed this utterance to one another? In fact they are a rebellious people.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, have they bequeathed it one to another? Nay, but they are an insolent people.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Have they bequeathed its Unto each other! Nay! they are a people contumacious.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Have they (the people of the past) transmitted this saying to these (Quraish pagans)? Nay, they are themselves a people transgressing beyond bounds (in disbelief)!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Did they recommend it to one another? In fact, they are rebellious people.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Have they arrived at a common understanding concerning this? No; but they are a people given to transgression.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Have they transmitted this saying to these Nay, they are themselves a people transgressing beyond bounds!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Have they handed down (the saying) as an heirloom one unto another? Nay, but they are froward folk.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Did they enjoin this upon one another?! Rather, they were a rebellious lot.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Have they handed this down from one to another? No, rather, they are an insolent nation.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Did they suggest it to them? Rather, they [themselves] are a transgressing people.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Have they inherited such dealings with the Prophets from their predecessors or are they a rebellious people?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Have they charged each other with this? Nay! they are an inordinate people.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Atawasaw bihi bal hum qawmun taghoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Have they handed this down to one another? They are certainly a people who exceed all bounds,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Is this the legacy they have transmitted, one to another? Nay, they are themselves a people transgressing beyond bounds!

verses.text: فَتَوَلَ‌ عَنْهُمْ‌ فَمَا أَنْتَ‌ بِمَلُومٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بنابراین از این سبک مغزان باطل گو، روی برگردان [که تو اتمام حجت کردی] و شایسته سرزنش نیستی؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس، از آنها رويگردان شو. كس تو را ملامت نخواهد كرد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس از آنها روى بگردان كه تو مورد ملامت نخواهى بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس، از آنان روى بگردان، كه تو در خور نكوهش نيستى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس (تو هم ای رسول ما) از این مردم کافر روی بگردان که (اتمام حجّت کردی و) دیگر هیچ در خور نکوهش و ملامت نیستی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: از ستیزه‌ی با آنان روی بگردان، چون تو سرزنش نمیگردی (که چرا ایشان ایمان نمی‌آورند). [[«تَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ»: از ستیزه با آنان روی بگردان، چرا که ایشان متکبر و ستیزه‌جویند «مَلُومٍ»: لومه شده. سزاوار سرزنش.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس، از آنان روی بگردان که تو سزاوار سرزنش نیستی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: حال که چنین است از آنها روی بگردان که هرگز در خور ملامت نخواهی بود؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس روی برتاب از ایشان که نیستی تو نکوهیده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس، از آنان روى گردان، كه در خور سرزنش نيستى- زيرا تكليف خود را انجام داده‌اى-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس، از آنان روی بگردان، پس تو در خور سرزنش نیستی.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Turn away from them. You will not be blamed.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore turn away from them (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), – so there is no blame upon you.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So turn thou from them; thou wilt not be reproached.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So turn away thou from them, not thou art blameworthy.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So turn away (O Muhammad SAW) from them (Quraish pagans) you are not to be blamed (as you have conveyed Allah's Message).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So turn away from them; you are not to blame.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So turn your attention away from them; you shall incur no blame.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So turn away from them, you are not blameworthy.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So withdraw from them (O Muhammad), for thou art in no wise blameworthy,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So turn away from them, as you will not be blameworthy.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So turn away from them, you shall not be blamed,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So leave them, [O Muhammad], for you are not to be blamed.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), leave them alone and you will not be blamed.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then turn your back upon them for you are not to blame;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fatawalla AAanhum fama anta bimaloomin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: so ignore them, you are not to blame,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So turn away from them: not thine is the blame.

verses.text: وَ ذَکِّرْ فَإِنَ‌ الذِّکْرَى‌ تَنْفَعُ‌ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و پند ده؛ زیرا پند به مؤمنان سود می دهد؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اندرز بده كه اندرز، مؤمنان را سودمند افتد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اندرز ده كه اندرز، مؤمنان را سود مى‌بخشد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و پند ده، كه مؤمنان را پند سود بخشد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (امّت را) تذکّر و پند می‌ده که پند و تذکّر (اگر کافران را نفع ندهد) مؤمنان را سودمند افتد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پند و اندرز بده، چرا که پند و اندرز به مؤمنان سود می‌رساند (و کاری می‌کند که خدا را فراموش نکنند، و پیوسته بر ایمان و یقینشان بیفزایند). [[«الذِّکْری»: موعظه حسنه. پند و اندرزی که انسان را به یاد خدا می‌اندازد و موجب تقویت ایمان و افزایش تقوا می‌گردد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و پند بده که اندرز مؤمنان را سود دهد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و پیوسته تذکّر ده، زیرا تذکّر مؤمنان را سود می‌بخشد.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و یادآوری کن که یادآوری سود دهد به مؤمنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و يادآورى كن و پند ده، كه يادآورى و پند، مؤمنان را سود دارد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و یاد(شان) آور، که مؤمنان را بی‌گمان، یادواره سودمند است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But go on reminding them, as reminding benefits the believers.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And advise, for advice benefits the Muslims.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And remind; the Reminder profits the believers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And admonish, for verily admonition profiteth the believers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And remind (by preaching the Quran, O Muhammad SAW) for verily, the reminding profits the believers.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And remind, for the reminder benefits the believers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do, however, keep exhorting them; for exhortation benefits those endowed with faith.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And remind, for verily, the reminding profits the believers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And warn, for warning profiteth believers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And admonish, for admonition indeed benefits the faithful.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But remind, the Reminder will benefit the believers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Keep on reminding them. This benefits the believers.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And continue to remind, for surely the reminder profits the believers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wathakkir fainna alththikra tanfaAAu almumineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: but keep on exhorting them, for exhortation benefits the believers.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But teach (thy Message) for teaching benefits the Believers.

verses.text: وَ مَا خَلَقْتُ‌ الْجِنَ‌ وَ الْإِنْسَ‌ إِلاَّ لِيَعْبُدُونِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و جن و انس را جز برای اینکه مرا بپرستند نیافریدیم؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: جن و انس را جز براى پرستش خود نيافريده‌ام.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و جن و انس را نيافريدم مگر براى اين كه مرا بندگى كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و جن و انس را نيافريدم جز براى آنكه مرا بپرستند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و من جنّ و انس را نیافریدم مگر برای اینکه مرا (به یکتایی) پرستش کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: من پریها و انسانها را جز برای پرستش خود نیافریده‌ام. [[«لِیَعْبُدُونِ»: تا مرا پرستش و بندگی کنند (نگا: بینه / 5).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و جن و انس را جز برای آنکه مرا بپرستند، نیافریده‌ام‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: من جنّ و انس را نیافریدم جز برای اینکه عبادتم کنند (و از این راه تکامل یابند و به من نزدیک شوند)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نه آفریدم پری و آدمی را مگر تا پرستشم کنند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و پريان و آدميان را نيافريدم مگر تا مرا [به يگانگى‌] بپرستند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و جنّ و انس را نیافریدم جز برای آنکه مرا بپرستند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: I have not created the jinns and men but to worship Me.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And I created the jinns and men, only for them to worship Me.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: I have not created jinn and mankind except to serve Me.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And have not created the Jinn and mankind but that they should worship Me.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And I (Allah) created not the jinns and humans except they should worship Me (Alone).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: I did not create the jinn and the humans except to worship Me.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: I created the jinn and humans for nothing else but that they may serve Me;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And I created not the Jinn and mankind except that they should worship Me.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: I created the jinn and humankind only that they might worship Me.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: I did not create the jinn and the humans except that they may worship Me.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: I have not created mankind and jinn except to worship Me.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We have created jinn and human beings only that they might worship Me.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And I have not created the jinn and the men except that they should serve Me.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama khalaqtu aljinna waalinsa illa liyaAAbudooni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: I created the jinn and mankind only so that they might worship Me:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: I have only created Jinns and men, that they may serve Me.

verses.text: مَا أُرِيدُ مِنْهُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ رِزْقٍ‌ وَ مَا أُرِيدُ أَنْ‌ يُطْعِمُونِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: از آنان هیچ رزقی نمی خواهم، و نمی خواهم که مرا طعام دهند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از آنها رزقى نمى‌خواهم و نمى‌خواهم كه مرا اطعام كنند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: از آنان هيچ روزيى نمى‌خواهم، و نمى‌خواهم كه مرا اطعام كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: از آنان هيچ روزيى نمى‌خواهم، و نمى‌خواهم كه مرا خوراك دهند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: من از (خلق) آنها رزق و طعام (و هیچ گونه سودی) بر خود نخواستم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: من از آنان نه درخواست هیچ گونه رزق و روزی می‌کنم، و نه می‌خواهم که مرا خوراک دهند. [[«مَآ أُرِیدُ مِنْهُمْ ...»: من بی‌نیاز از جهانیانم و روزی‌ده ایشانم؛ نه روزیخوار آنان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: از آنان رزقی نخواسته‌ام و نخواسته‌ام که به من خوراک دهند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هرگز از آنها روزی نمی‌خواهم، و نمی‌خواهم مرا اطعام کنند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نخواهم از آنان روزیی و نخواهم که مرا خورانند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: از آنان روزيى نمى‌خواهم و نمى‌خواهم كه مرا طعام دهند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: از آنان هیچ روزی نمی‌خواهم و نمی‌خواهم که مرا خوراک دهند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: I want no sustenance from them nor do I want them to feed Me.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: I do not ask any sustenance from them, nor wish that they give Me food.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: I desire of them no provision, neither do I desire that they should feed Me.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: I seek not any provision from them, nor I desire that they should feed Me.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: I seek not any provision from them (i.e. provision for themselves or for My creatures) nor do I ask that they should feed Me (i.e. feed themselves or My creatures).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: I need no livelihood from them, nor do I need them to feed Me.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: I desire from them no provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: I seek not any provision from them nor do I ask that they should feed Me.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: I seek no livelihood from them, nor do I ask that they should feed Me.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: I desire no provision from them, nor do I desire that they should feed Me.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: I do not desire provision from them, nor do I desire that they should feed Me.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: I do not expect to receive any sustenance from them or that they should feed Me.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: I do not desire from them any sustenance and I do not desire that they should feed Me.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ma oreedu minhum min rizqin wama oreedu an yutAAimooni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: I seek no sustenance from them, nor do I want them to feed Me --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: No Sustenance do I require of them, nor do I require that they should feed Me.

verses.text: إِنَ‌ اللَّهَ‌ هُوَ الرَّزَّاقُ‌ ذُو الْقُوَّةِ الْمَتِينُ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید خدا خود روزی دهنده و صاحب قدرت استوار است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خداست روزى‌دهنده. و اوست صاحب نيرويى سخت استوار.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همانا خداوند، خود روزى‌رسان و صاحب قدرت و توانمند است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: خداست كه خود روزى بخش نيرومند استوار است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: همانا روزی بخشنده خلق تنها خداست که صاحب قوّت و قدرت ابدی است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تنها خدا روزی‌رسان و صاحب قدرت و نیرومند است و بس. [[«ذُوالْقُوَّةِ»: دارای نیرو. «الْمَتِینُ»: دارای نیروی فراوان. تأکید (ذُوالْقُوَّةِ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان خداوند است که روزی‌بخش نیرومند استوار است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: خداوند روزی‌دهنده و صاحب قوّت و قدرت است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا خدا است روزی‌دهنده توانای نیرومند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: زيرا خداست روزى‌دهنده و با نيرو و توانمند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: همواره خداست که خود بسی روزی‌دهنده‌ی نیرومند استوار است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: God is certainly the great provider, Lord of strength and power.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed it is Allah, Who is the Greatest Sustainer, the Strong, the Able.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely God is the All-provider, the Possessor of Strength, the Ever-Sure.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily Allah! He is the Provider, Owner of power, Firm.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, Allah is the All-Provider, Owner of Power, the Most Strong.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: God is the Provider, the One with Power, the Strong.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Surely Allah is the Bestower of all provision, the Lord of all power, the Strong.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, Allah is the All-Provider, Owner of power, the Most Strong.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! Allah! He it is that giveth livelihood, the Lord of unbreakable might.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed it is Allah who is the All-provider, Powerful and All-strong.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Surely, Allah is the Provider, the Possessor of Power, the Mighty.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, it is Allah who is the [continual] Provider, the firm possessor of strength.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It is God Who is the Sustainer and the Lord of invincible strength.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely Allah is the Bestower of sustenance, the Lord of Power, the Strong.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna Allaha huwa alrrazzaqu thoo alquwwati almateenu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: it is God who is the great Sustainer, the Mighty One, the Invincible.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For Allah is He Who gives (all) Sustenance,- Lord of Power,- Steadfast (for ever).

verses.text: فَإِنَ‌ لِلَّذِينَ‌ ظَلَمُوا ذَنُوباً مِثْلَ‌ ذَنُوبِ‌ أَصْحَابِهِمْ‌ فَلاَ يَسْتَعْجِلُونِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس برای کسانی [از قوم تو] که ستم ورزیدند، سهمی از عذاب است مانند سهم هم مسلکانشان [از امت های پیشین]، بنابراین شتاب در آمدن آن را نخواهند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اين ستمكاران را از عذاب بهره‌اى است همانند بهره‌اى كه يارانشان داشتند. پس به شتاب چيزى از من نخواهند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس براى كسانى كه ستم كردند، سهم بزرگى از عذاب است همانند سهم يارانشان [از ستمگران گذشته‌]، بنابر اين عجله نكنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس براى كسانى كه ستم كردند بهره‌اى است از عذاب، همانند بهره عذاب ياران [قبلى‌]شان. پس [بگو:] در خواستن عذاب از من، شتابزدگى نكنند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس این ستمکاران را هم گناهی و کیفری مانند اصحاب و امثالشان (از امم پیشین) خواهد بود، باری آن را به عجله از من نخواهند (و به مهلتی که دادیم مغرور نشوند البتّه روز انتقامشان می‌رسد).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: کسانی که ستم می‌کنند، سهم بزرگی از عذاب دارند، همانند سهم بزرگ یارانشان (از اقوام ستمگر پیشین!). بنابراین، از من به شتاب وقوع عذاب را مخواهید. [[«ذَنُوباً»: سطل بزرگ، دلوهای بزرگی که دنباله دارند. «فَلا یَسْتَعْجِلُونِ»: (نگا: انبیاء / 37).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آری برای [این‌] ستمکاران هم نصیبی [از عذاب‌] همانند نصیب یارانشان است، نباید که به شتابش از من بطلبند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و برای کسانی که ستم کردند، سهم بزرگی از عذاب است همانند سهم یارانشان (از اقوام ستمگر پیشین)؛ بنابر این عجله نکنند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: هرآینه آنان را که ستم کردند بهره‌ای است مانند بهره یارانشان پس شتاب نجویند از من‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا كسانى را كه [با كفر ورزيدن به خود] ستم كردند بهره‌اى است از عذاب همانند بهره ياران [گذشته‌] آنها. پس [آن را] به شتاب از من نخواهند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس بی‌گمان برای کسانی که ستم کردند پیامدی بد است؛ همانند پیامد بد یارانشان. پس در خواستن عذاب از من شتاب نجویند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Those who do wrong will indeed come to the same end as their fellows (of old). So let them not ask Me to hasten (the punishment).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed for these unjust is also a turn of punishment, like that of their companions – so they must not ask Me to hasten.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: The evildoers shall have their portion, like the portion of their fellows; so let them not hasten Me!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So verily Unto those who do wrong there is a portion like Unto the portion of their fellows; wherefore let them not ask Me to hasten on.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And verily, for those who do wrong, there is a portion of torment like to the evil portion of torment (which came for) their likes (of old), so let them not ask Me to hasten on!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Those who do wrong will have their turn, like the turn of their counterparts, so let them not rush Me.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: The wrong-doers shall receive a portion of the chastisements as their fellows (of yore). So let them not rush Me.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily, for those who do wrong, there is a portion of torment like to the evil portion of torment (which came for) their likes (of old); so let them not ask Me to hasten on!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! for those who (now) do wrong there is an evil day like unto the evil day (which came for) their likes (of old); so let them not ask Me to hasten on (that day).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed the lot of those who do wrong [now] will be like the lot of their [earlier] counterparts. So let them not ask Me to hasten on [that fate].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: The evildoers shall have for their portion, a portion like their companions (who were destroyed before them). Therefore, they should not ask Us to hasten!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a portion [of punishment] like the portion of their predecessors, so let them not impatiently urge Me.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The unjust will bear a burden like that of their unjust predecessors. Let them not make Me bring immediate punishment upon them.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So surely those who are unjust shall have a portion like the portion of their companions, therefore let them not ask Me to hasten on.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fainna lillatheena thalamoo thanooban mithla thanoobi ashabihim fala yastaAAjiloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: The wrongdoers will meet the same fate as their predecessors, let them not ask Me to hasten on [the punishment],

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For the Wrong-doers, their portion is like unto the portion of their fellows (of earlier generations): then let them not ask Me to hasten (that portion)!

verses.text: فَوَيْلٌ‌ لِلَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا مِنْ‌ يَوْمِهِمُ‌ الَّذِي‌ يُوعَدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس وای بر کسانی که کافر شدند از آن روزشان که به آن وعده داده می شوند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: واى بر كافران، از آن روز كه آنها را وعده داده‌اند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس واى بر كسانى كه كافر شدند از آن روزشان كه وعده داده مى‌شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس واى بر كسانى كه كافر شده‌اند از آن روزى كه وعده يافته‌اند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس (آن گاه که زمان کیفر فرا رسید) وای بر آنان که کافر شدند از آن روز سختی که (رسولان) به آنها وعده می‌دهند (که در دنیا به قتل و اسارت و در عقبی به قهر و عقوبت محکومند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: واویلا بر کافران! از دست آن روزی که ایشان بدان وعده داده می‌شوند. [[«فَوَیْلٌ لِلَّذِینَ ...»: (نگا: ابراهیم / 2، مریم / 37، ص / 27، زخرف / 65).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس وای بر کافران از آن روزشان که وعده‌اش را به ایشان داده‌اند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس وای بر کسانی که کافر شدند از روزی که به آنها وعده داده می‌شود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس وای از برای آنان که کفر ورزیدند از روز ایشان که وعده داده شوند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس واى بر كافران از آن روزشان كه وعده داده مى‌شوند- روز رستاخيز-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس وای برای کسانی که کافر شدند از آن روزشان که وعده داده می‌شوند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Alas the woe for those who refuse to believe in the Day which has been promised them.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So ruin is for disbelievers, from their day – which they are promised.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So woe to the unbelievers, for that day of theirs that they are promised.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Woe, then, Unto those who disbelieve in their Day which they are promised.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then, woe to those who disbelieve (in Allah and His Oneness Islamic Monotheism) from (that) their Day which they have been promised (for their punishment).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So woe to those who disbelieve because of that Day of theirs which they are promised.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Woe, then, betide those who disbelieved in that Day of theirs which they are being asked to hold in dread.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then woe to those who disbelieve from their Day which they have been promised.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And woe unto those who disbelieve, from (that) their day which they are promised.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Woe to the faithless for the day they are promised!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Woe then to the unbelievers for their Day which they were promised!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And woe to those who have disbelieved from their Day which they are promised.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Woe to the disbelievers when the day with which they have been threatened comes!

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore woe to those who disbelieve because of their day which they are threatened with.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fawaylun lillatheena kafaroo min yawmihimu allathee yooAAadoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: woe, then, to those who are bent on denying the truth, when the Day arrives which they have been promised.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Woe, then, to the Unbelievers, on account of that Day of theirs which they have been promised!
